title.native: アニ×パラ〜あなたのヒーローは誰ですか〜
title.romaji: ANI x PARA: Anata no Hero wa Dare desu ka
title.english: Animation × Paralympic: Who Is Your Hero?

description:
“ANIMATION × PARALYMPIC: Who Is Your Hero?” is a special series featuring fictional Paralympic athletes depicted in world-renowned Japanese animation. The project aims to introduce new Paralympic sports heroes through attractive characters and stories that will be created by the collaboration of famous comic creators and animation film directors. The series will increase the number of featured sports by 2020.

An episode animated by Kyoto Animation was scheduled to be broadcast in August 2019, but was later announced to be cancelled after it was determined production could not be completed in time for the 2020 Paralympic Games due to a tragic arson attack on the studio.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Football
tags.description: Centers around the sport of football (known in the USA as "soccer").

tags.description: Centers around the sport of tennis.

tags.description: Centers around the sport of rugby.

tags.name: Athletics
tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Cycling
tags.description: Centers around the sport of cycling.

tags.name: Police

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/前田実)

Well-known for his work in the [Dragon Ball](https://anilist.co/anime/223/) series.

_Note: Not to be confused with [background artist](https://anilist.co/staff/219450/)._
__Birthplace:__ Nerima-ku, Tokyo, Japan __Stage Name:__ Kouki Okamoto __Kouki Hayashi__, better known by stage name Kouki Okamoto, is a Japanese guitarist, composer and member of the band OKAMOTO'S.

__Website | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube | Facebook__ Biography Okamoto's is a Japanese rock band, formed in 2006. They made their major label debut May 26, 2010 and were signed by record label Ariola Japan. Okamoto's was formed by four junior high school students. Fans of influential Japanese avant-garde artist Tarou Okamoto, the members took a cue from The Ramones and each adopted stage names with the surname Okamoto. Members __[Shou Okamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/148602) (オカモトショウ)__ – vocals Real name Shou Iimura (飯村翔). Born October 19, 1990 in New York City. Former member of Zutto Zuletellz (ズットズレテルズ/Zuttozureteruzu) and the children's performance group Precoci. Son of American jazz saxophonist Scott Hamilton. __[Kouki Okamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/148604) (オカモトコウキ)__ – guitar Real name Kouki Hayashi (林幸希i). Born November 5, 1990 in Nerima City, Tokyo, Japan. Reiji Okamoto (オカモトレイジ) – drums Real name Reiji Miyake (三宅零治). Born January 9, 1991 in Futako-Tamagawa, Setagaya, Tokyo. Former Zutto Zuletellz member. He is the eldest son of The Privates lead singer Tatsuji Nobuhara (延原達治). In his childhood he made child role dramas. Hama Okamoto (ハマ・オカモト) – bass Real name Ikumi Hamada (濵田郁未). Born March 12, 1991 in Tokyo. Former Zutto Zuletellz member. He is the eldest son of Masatoshi Hamada and Natsumi Ogawa. Former Members Masaru Okamoto (オカモトマサル) – bass (2006–2009) (Source: Wikipedia)

Youichi Takahashi is a mangaka, best known for [Captain Tsubasa](https://anilist.co/manga/31789/Captain-Tsubasa/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/0728takahashi)

__Birthplace:__ New York City, New York, USA __Shou Iimura__, better known by stage name Shou Okamoto, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and former member of Zutto Zuletellz and the children's performance group Precoci. Currently a vocalist in the band OKAMOTO'S
